title: Houston Police Chief Films Rescue of Residents From Floodwater
text:
Houston Police Chief Art Acevedo filmed the rescue of a family pushed out of their home by floodwater on September 19, footage posted online shows.

Acevedo livestreamed emergency operations he led in the Houston area as Tropical Depression Imelda continued to dump rain on the city and surrounding towns.

One of several videos streamed on Acevedo’s Periscope account shows the rescue of a family whose home was surrounded by floodwaters. Inside their house, water was ankle-deep.

Acevedo locked the family’s door and asked if the power was off, then ushered the family to a waiting police truck, filled with other residents being rescued. Credit: Houston Police Chief Art Acevedo via Storyful

One of several videos streamed on Acevedo’s Periscope account shows the rescue of a family whose home was surrounded by floodwaters. Inside their house, water was ankle-deep. Acevedo locked the family’s door and asked if the power was off, then ushered the family to a waiting police truck, filled with other residents being rescued. Credit: Houston Police Chief Art Acevedo via Storyful
